head.title: Metro Business; Utility and Union Settle

hedline.hl1: Metro Business; Utility and Union Settle

abstract.p: New York Power Authority, state-owned utility, and Local 1-2 of the Utility Workers of America reach tentative contract (S)

block.p: The New York Power Authority, the state-owned utility, and the union representing 418 power plant workers have reached a tentative contract, it was announced yesterday.

The union, Local 1-2 of the Utility Workers of America, said 68 employees at the Poletti power plant in Astoria, Queens, and 350 at the Indian Point 3 nuclear power plant in Westchester County had been working without an agreement since Jan. 17.
The New York Power Authority, the state-owned utility, and the union representing 418 power plant workers have reached a tentative contract, it was announced yesterday.

The union, Local 1-2 of the Utility Workers of America, said 68 employees at the Poletti power plant in Astoria, Queens, and 350 at the Indian Point 3 nuclear power plant in Westchester County had been working without an agreement since Jan. 17.
The new agreement calls for a 10.5 percent wage increase over three years and a job security provision that will help protect workers after the planned sale of Indian Point 3 to Energy Services Inc.
